data.title: budynki photos on Flickr
data.meta_description: Flickr photos, groups, and tags related to the "budynki" Flickr tag.
data.text:
Rila Monastery - the monastery was founded in the 14th century on the site of the hermitage Ivan Rila existing since the 10th century in the valley of Rila mountain.

Modern form of the monastery dates from the 19th century, when through the victims of Bulgarian society and with the agreement of the Turkish authorities built a huge monastery complex. The walls of a thickness of 2 m and a height of 24 m giving it the appearance of a fortified stronghold. The inner courtyard is surrounded by three-storey buildings with arches painted in black and white and wooden galleries.

The main church of the Holy Mother of God is a three-nave basilica based on a cruciform plan with a dome at the intersection of the aisles. The pride of the temple are frescoes and great iconostasis.

In 1983 the monastery was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

-

WspÃ³Å‚czesna postaÄ‡ monastyru pochodzi z XIX w., kiedy to dziÄ™ki ofiarom spoÅ‚eczeÅ„stwa buÅ‚garskiego i przy zgodzie wÅ‚adz tureckich wybudowano ogromny kompleks klasztorny. Mury gruboÅ›ci 2 m i wysokoÅ›ci 24 m nadajÄ… mu wyglÄ…d warownej twierdzy. WewnÄ™trzny dziedziniec otaczajÄ… trÃ³jkondygnacyjne budynki z Å‚ukami pomalowanymi na czarno i biaÅ‚o oraz drewnianymi kruÅ¼gankami.

GÅ‚Ã³wna cerkiew pod wezwaniem ÅšwiÄ™tej Bogurodzicy to trÃ³jnawowa bazylika oparta na planie krzyÅ¼a z kopuÅ‚Ä… na skrzyÅ¼owaniu naw. OzdobÄ… Å›wiÄ…tyni sÄ… freski i olbrzymi ikonostas.

W 1983 monastyr zostaÅ‚ wpisany na listÄ™ Å›wiatowego dziedzictwa UNESCO.

The Old Town in Lublin did not suffer during World War II. Buildings that were built over many decades have survived unchanged, reflecting the atmosphere of past times.

The Lublin Town Square is the central part of the Old Town, it has an irregular shape in the form of a trapezoid with dimensions: 62 x 72 m. The developing city became an important judicial center through the establishment of the Crown Tribunal in Lublin in 1578. For the needs of the session of the Tribunal, the building of the town hall, located in the middle of the Market Square, was renovated. The market square is surrounded by stylish tenement houses that give the city a unique charm.

-

Stare Miasto w Lublinie nie ucierpiaÅ‚o podczas dziaÅ‚aÅ„ II Wojny Åšwiatowej. Budynki ktÃ³re powstawaÅ‚y na przestrzeni wielu dziesiÄ™cioleci przetrwaÅ‚y w niezmienionym stanie, oddajÄ…c atmosferÄ™ minionych czasÃ³w.

Rynek lubelski jest centralnÄ… czÄ™Å›ciÄ… Starego Miasta, posiada nieregularny ksztaÅ‚t w formie trapezu o wymiarach: 62 x 72 m. Wytyczenie Rynku Starego Miasta Å‚Ä…czy siÄ™ z czasem nadania Lublinowi prawa magdeburskiego przez WÅ‚adysÅ‚awa Åokietka w 1317 roku. RozwijajÄ…ce siÄ™ miasto staÅ‚o siÄ™ waÅ¼nym oÅ›rodkiem sÄ…downiczym, poprzez utworzenie w Lublinie w roku 1578 TrybunaÅ‚u Koronnego. Na potrzeby sesji TrybunaÅ‚u zostaÅ‚ odremontowany budynek ratusza, ktÃ³ry stoi siÄ™ na Å›rodku Rynku. Rynek otoczony jest stylowymi kamienicami, ktÃ³re nadajÄ… miastu niepowtarzalnego uroku.

Wielkopolski Ethnographic Park in Dziekanowice is part of Museum of the First Piast at Lednica.

The construction of the museum began in September 29, 1975. The first exhibition opened to the public June 1, 1982.

The museum presents houses, stable, barn with equipment. The individual buildings are organized into pens and oriented in such a way that all created life-size village. The composition is complemented by wooden church, a chapel with a cemetery, the baroque mansion with grange, inn, windmills, water mill. The youngest building dates from 1935 and the oldest parts date back to 1602. There are already 53 objects and the collection is growing steadily.

-

Wielkopolski Park Etnograficzny w Dziekanowicach jest czÄ™Å›ciÄ… Muzeum Pierwszych PiastÃ³w na Lednicy.

BudowÄ™ skansenu rozpoczÄ™to w 29 wrzeÅ›nia 1975. PierwszÄ… ekspozycjÄ™ udostÄ™pniono zwiedzajÄ…cym 1 czerwca 1982.

W skansenie prezentowane sÄ… domy, budynki inwentarskie, stodoÅ‚y wraz z wyposaÅ¼eniem. PoszczegÃ³lne budynki zorganizowane sÄ… w zagrody i zorientowane w taki sposÃ³b by caÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡ tworzyÅ‚a naturalnej wielkoÅ›ci wieÅ›. KompozycjÄ™ uzupeÅ‚niajÄ… drewniany koÅ›ciÃ³Å‚, kaplica z cmentarzem, barokowy dwÃ³r z folwarkiem, karczma, wiatraki, mÅ‚yn wodny. NajmÅ‚odszy budynek pochodzi z 1935 roku a najstarsze elementy datowane sÄ… na rok 1602. Jest ich juÅ¼ 53 i kolekcja sukcesywnie powiÄ™ksza siÄ™.

Mostar is a city in southwestern Bosnia and Herzegovina on Neretva River. The name comes from word mostari ("bridge guards"). On the left bank is the Old Town (Muslim part) with the famous street "Kujundjiluk". The right bank of the city is inhabited mainly by Croats. The banks of Neretva within the old part city are connected by a stone bridge built by Turks in 1566, called the "Old Bridge".

Kujundjiluk is the most famous street of Old Town Mostar. Its name comes from the masters of blacksmith settled on the left bank of the river (kulundÅ¼ije)

In November 1993, as a result of hostilities, Croatian missiles destroyed historic buildings and a bridge. The reconstruction of buildings and the bridge was completed in 2004. In July 2005, the Old Bridge and its immediate surroundings (KujundÅ¾iluk - the old bazaar) were added to the UNESCO World Cultural Heritage list.

-

Mostar jest miastem w poÅ‚udniowo-zachodniej BoÅ›ni i Hercegowinie nad rzekÄ… NeretwÄ…. Nazwa pochodzi od sÅ‚owa mostari (â€straÅ¼nicy mostuâ€). Na lewym brzegu poÅ‚oÅ¼one jest Stare Miasto (czÄ™Å›Ä‡ muzuÅ‚maÅ„ska) ze sÅ‚ynnÄ… ulicÄ… "KujundÅ¼iluk". PrawobrzeÅ¼na czÄ™Å›Ä‡ miasta jest zamieszkaÅ‚a gÅ‚Ã³wnie przez ChorwatÃ³w. Brzegi Neretwy w obrÄ™bie starej czÄ™Å›ci miasta Å‚Ä…czy wybudowany przez TurkÃ³w w 1566 roku kamienny most, zwany "Stary Most".

KujundÅ¼iluk jest najsÅ‚ynniejszÄ… uliczkÄ… starÃ³wki Mostaru. Jej nazwa pochodzi od osiadÅ‚ych na lewym brzegu rzeki mistrzÃ³w kowalstwa (kulundÅ¼ije)

W listopadzie 1993, w wyniku dziaÅ‚aÅ„ wojennych, Chorwackie pociski zniszczyÅ‚y zabytkowe budynki oraz most. OdbudowÄ™ budynkÃ³w i mostu zakoÅ„czono w 2004 roku. W lipcu 2005 Stary Most i jego najbliÅ¼sze otoczenie (KujundÅ¾iluk - stary bazar) zostaÅ‚y wpisane na listÄ™ Å›wiatowego dziedzictwa kulturowego UNESCO.

Michaelsberg Abbey is a former Benedictine monastery in Bamberg, Bavaria. Due to their hilltop location, the buildings of former monastery are visible from many places in Bamberg.

The entire complex consists with church, monastery buildings and terraced gardens surrounding them.

The first church of St. Michael on this site was built around 1015. Later, the whole building was rebuilt and enlarged many times. After the turbulent history of Reformation and military activities, the monastery was dissolved in 1803. The buildings were turned into a poorhouse and hospital, which still serves as a retirement home. The former cloister church remains in use as a church (Michaelskirche) and is now an auxiliary church of the cathedral. The area has been on UNESCO World Heritage List since 1993.

Since 2012, the church has been closed as renovation work is underway, which is expected to end in 2021.

-

Od 1993 roku obszar ten znajduje siÄ™ na liÅ›cie Å›wiatowego dziedzictwa UNESCO.

Od roku 2012 koÅ›ciÃ³Å‚ zostaÅ‚ zamkniÄ™ty gdyÅ¼ trwajÄ… prace nad renowacjÄ…, ktÃ³ra ma siÄ™ zakoÅ„czyÄ‡ w 2021 roku.

The Krzemieniec Secondary School was a Polish school in Volhynia, existing in the years 1805â€“1831, reactivated in the years 1922â€“1939, also known as the Volyn Athens. It played a significant role in the development of the level of Polish culture in Volhynia.

The school was founded by Tadeusz Czacki, with the participation of Hugo KoÅ‚Å‚Ä…taj. It was located in the seat of the former Jesuit College in the architectural complex of the WiÅ›niowieccy Palace (shown in this photo). Juliusz SÅ‚owacki's father was the teacher here.

After the fall of the November Uprising, the tsarist Russian authorities closed the school. Even trees from a rich botanical garden were taken away. After the Second World War, the school and church buildings were further devastated and looted.

-

Liceum Krzemienieckie byÅ‚o polskÄ… szkoÅ‚Ä… na WoÅ‚yniu, istniejÄ…ca w latach 1805â€“1831, reaktywowana w latach 1922â€“1939, zwana takÅ¼e Atenami WoÅ‚yÅ„skimi. OdegraÅ‚a znaczÄ…cÄ… rolÄ™ w rozwoju poziomu kultury polskiej na WoÅ‚yniu.

SzkoÅ‚Ä™ zaÅ‚oÅ¼yÅ‚ Tadeusz Czacki, przy udziale Hugona KoÅ‚Å‚Ä…taja. MieÅ›ciÅ‚a siÄ™ w siedzibie dawnego Kolegium Jezuickiego w zespole architektonicznym paÅ‚acu WiÅ›niowieckich (widoczne na tym zdjÄ™ciu). Tutaj nauczycielem byÅ‚ ojciec Juliusza SÅ‚owackiego.

Po upadku Powstania Listopadowego, wÅ‚adze carskiej Rosji zlikwidowaÅ‚y szkoÅ‚Ä™. Wywieziono nawet drzewa z bogatego ogrodu botanicznego. Po II Wojnie Åšwiatowej budynki szkoÅ‚y i koÅ›cioÅ‚a ulegÅ‚y dalszej dewastacji i rozkradzeniu.

The monastery complex was built in the 11th century. Probably funded by Kazimierz the Restorer. The facilities were built of granite and limestone available in the area. The hill and buildings were surrounded by a stone wall and rebuilt many times. Another reconstruction was made in the 15th century, which gave the monastery and the church gothic features. The church and monastery are covered with stellar and crystal vaults.

Under the entire complex there is a group of cellars covered with rocker vaults. It is one of the best preserved underground rooms from the Romanesque era in Poland. Particularly noteworthy is the "lower church" with a stone Romanesque altar.

The interior of the "upper church" comes from the 18th century reconstruction and represents mainly the Rococo and Baroque styles.

-

ZespÃ³Å‚ klasztorny zostaÅ‚ zbudowany w XI wieku. Prawdopodobnie ufundowany przez Kazimierza Odnowiciela. Obiekty zostaÅ‚y wzniesione z granitu i wapienia dostÄ™pnego w okolicy. WzgÃ³rze i budynki byÅ‚y otoczone kamiennym murem i wielokrotnie przebudowywano. W XV w. dokonano kolejnej rekonstrukcji, ktÃ³ra nadaÅ‚a klasztorowi i koÅ›cioÅ‚owi cechy gotyckie. KoÅ›ciÃ³Å‚ i klasztor pokrywajÄ… gwiaÅºdziste i krysztaÅ‚owe sklepienia.

Pod caÅ‚ym kompleksem znajduje siÄ™ zespÃ³Å‚ piwnic pokrytych sklepieniami koÅ‚yskowymi. Jest to jedno z najlepiej zachowanych w Polsce podziemnych pomieszczeÅ„ z epoki romaÅ„skiej. SzczegÃ³lnie godnym uwagi jest "dolny koÅ›ciÃ³Å‚" z kamiennym romaÅ„skim oÅ‚tarzem.

WnÄ™trze "gÃ³rnego koÅ›cioÅ‚a" pochodzi z okresu przebudowy XVIII w. i reprezentuje gÅ‚Ã³wnie styl rokokowy i barokowy.

Church of St. StanisÅ‚aw Bishop in Kalisz is a Franciscan monastery church, which is the oldest Franciscan convent in Greater Poland. The convent was founded in 1257 by prince BolesÅ‚aw the Pious and his wife, Blessed Jolenta. An early Gothic church was also built in the 13th century, later rebuilt. It is a building with an elongated presbytery adjoined by a three-nave body. The furnishings, mainly Baroque and Rococo, come from the 18th century.

The baroque monastery buildings adjoin the chancel on the south side.

-

KoÅ›ciÃ³Å‚ pw. Å›w. StanisÅ‚awa Biskupa w Kaliszu jest koÅ›cioÅ‚em klasztornym franciszkanÃ³w, ktÃ³ry jest najstarszym konwentem franciszkaÅ„skim w Wielkopolsce. Konwent powstaÅ‚ w 1257 roku z fundacji ksiÄ™cia BolesÅ‚awa PoboÅ¼nego i jego Å¼ony, bÅ‚ogosÅ‚awionej Jolenty. W XIII wieku powstaÅ‚ teÅ¼ wczesnogotycki koÅ›ciÃ³Å‚, pÃ³Åºniej przebudowany. The first written mention of the stronghold in LÄ…d comes from 1136. In the mid-thirteenth century, Mieszko III the Old settled here the Cistercian Order. For three centuries it was a German order, and from 1550 Poles resided in the abbey in LÄ…d. As a result of the partitions of Poland, LÄ…d was taken over by Prussia and the church property was confiscated. After the political changes in 1819 and the transition of LÄ…d to the Russian partition, the abbey was dissolved. In 1850 the monastery was settled by Capuchins, who were removed by the Russian authorities for helping the January Insurgents (1863-64). In 1921, after Poland regained independence, the Salesians were settled in LÄ…d. The Salesian Order and Seminary is still there today.

The monastery buildings are located on the right bank of the Warta River, and it includes the buildings of the former abbey, the church of Blessed Virgin Mary and St. Nicholas and the gardens of the monastery. The former abbey is an outstanding example of the Gothic and late Baroque style, closely related to the history of this region, and rebuilt many times. The church is a baroque temple, the construction of which began in 1651 and took almost 100 years. Earlier, an older church stood in this place, which was pulled down. The central nave and the dome were made in the years 1728â€“35 according to by Pompeo Ferrari.

-

View on the buildings and boats in ElblÄ…g, Poland :)

ElblÄ…g is a city in northern Poland on the eastern edge of the Å»uÅ‚awy region. ElblÄ…g is one of the oldest cities in the province. Its history dates back to 1237, when the Teutonic Order constructed their fortified stronghold on the banks of a nearby river. The castle subsequently served as the official seat of the Teutonic Order Masters. The city was transferred to Prussia after the first partition of Poland in 1772. After World War II the city again became part of Poland. Today, ElblÄ…g is a vibrant city with an attractive tourist base. It serves as an academic and financial center and among its numerous historic monuments is the Market Gate from 1309 and St. Nicholas Cathedral. ElblÄ…g is also known for its archaeological sites, museums and the largest brewery in the country.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

An interesting fact of Babimost is location the market sguare with town hall outside the current residential zone.

Originally, the wooden buildings of Babimost did not survive due to the fires several times consuming the city. It was not until the 1830s that masonry buildings were built, some of which have survived to this day. The town hall was then integrated into the eastern wing of the market square. After the destruction of World War II, the town hall was rebuilt only in the early 1960s.

The first written mention of the stronghold in LÄ…d comes from 1136. In the mid-thirteenth century, Mieszko III the Old settled here the Cistercian Order. For three centuries it was a German order, and from 1550 Poles resided in the abbey in LÄ…d. As a result of the partitions of Poland, LÄ…d was taken over by Prussia and the church property was confiscated. After the political changes in 1819 and the transition of LÄ…d to the Russian partition, the abbey was dissolved. In 1850 the monastery was settled by Capuchins, who were removed by the Russian authorities for helping the January Insurgents (1863-64). In 1921, after Poland regained independence, the Salesians were settled in LÄ…d. The Salesian Order and Seminary is still there today.

The monastery buildings are located on the right bank of the Warta River, and it includes the buildings of the former abbey, the church of Blessed Virgin Mary and St. Nicholas and the gardens of the monastery. The former abbey is an outstanding example of the Gothic and late Baroque style, closely related to the history of this region, and rebuilt many times. The church is a baroque temple, the construction of which began in 1651 and took almost 100 years. Earlier, an older church stood in this place, which was pulled down. The central nave and the dome were made in the years 1728â€“35 according to by Pompeo Ferrari.

Monastery of St. Antym is located in Bucharest, hidden between the modern blocks of flats from the time of Nicolae Ceausescu. It was built in 1713-1715 by Saint Antim Ivireanu, then bishop of the metropolis of Wallachia. The buildings were returned to the monastery by Patriarch Justinian Marina in the 1950s. The monastery also has a museum with religious items and facts about the life of Antim Ivireanu.

Certainly, it can be considered a pearl lying among contemporary concrete blocks of flats.

-

Wielkopolski Ethnographic Park in Dziekanowice is part of Museum of the First Piast at Lednica.

The construction of the museum began in September 29, 1975. The first exhibition opened to the public June 1, 1982.

The museum presents houses, stable, barn with equipment. The individual buildings are organized into pens and oriented in such a way that all created life-size village. The composition is complemented by wooden church, a chapel with a cemetery, the baroque mansion with grange, inn, windmills, water mill. The youngest building dates from 1935 and the oldest parts date back to 1602. There are already 53 objects and the collection is growing steadily.

-
